title: User can view results of MJC stat batch
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is running the MJC Stat batch
custom_steps: WHEN the batch is complete
custom_expected: THEN the list of items(contracts) that were hit by the batch will display in the results widget

title: User can view errors in results widget on MJC stat batch
custom_preconds: GIVEN the MJC stat batch has run in Update mode
custom_steps: WHEN the user views the results widget
custom_expected: THEN an error will appear next to any item in the results widget that contained an error

title: Results from most recent batch will always appear
custom_preconds: GIVEN the MJC stat batch has previously been run
custom_steps: WHEN the user navigates to the MJC Stat batch screen
custom_expected: THEN the results from the most recent batch will display

title: User can view the history of the MJC stat
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user has navigated to the MJC stat batch
custom_steps: WHEN the user views the batch history widget
custom_expected:
THEN they will see a list of when the batch was run in the past year (check date picker being defaulted to one year in the past to present day) 
AND columns will batch wireframe http://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=contrat_expiration

title: LRD view progress of a running batch
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is on the MJC stat batch screen
custom_steps: WHEN the user clicks RUN
custom_expected:
THEN a progress bar will appear and will show the progress of the running batch 
AND Abort button will replace the Run and Close Buttons

title: LRD Abort a batch that is running
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user is on the MJC stat batch screen
AND the batch is running
custom_steps: WHEN the user clicks Abort
custom_expected:
THEN the batch will stop 
AND the screen will refresh 
AND the results will display all records that were processed before the batch was stopped.

title: LRD wants to see results of a past batch
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user is on the MJC stat batch screen 
AND is viewing the batch history widget
custom_steps: WHEN the user clicks on an batch history item from a previous batch
custom_expected: THEN the results from that past batch will display in the results widget

title: BOC user wants to see Parameters used for batch in batch history
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is logged in as a BOC user
custom_steps: WHEN user navigates to the Batch History widget
custom_expected:
THEN the Batch History Widget should match styling and layout in wireframe
AND Batch History Columns should match those in wireframe, including "Details" column outlining parameters selected for the relevant batch run

title: BOC admin user wants to view list of MJC Batches
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is logged in as a BOC admin user
AND user has navigated to the Batches tab on the system admin screen
custom_steps: WHEN user navigates to the Batches tab on the system admin screen
custom_expected:
THEN each Batch name should be a link and display under the Major Contracts Subsection
AND batch names: "MJ Contracts Statistics Batch", "Contract Expiration Batch", "MJ Award Bonus Batch" should display
AND batch names should display in alphabetical order
AND when user hovers over a batch name, a description should appear in browser tooltip
AND MJC Stat Batch Description should be: "Check against BAM"
AND the Last Run information (date, time, and the user who ran the last batch) should display to the right of the batch name as "Last Run: mm/dd/yyyy - hh:mm pm (username)"

title: BOC admin user wants to view batch screen while batches are running
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user is logged in as BOC admin user
AND one or more batches is currently running
custom_steps: WHEN user has navigated to the Batches screen
custom_expected:
THEN the number of batches running should display in the header (see wireframe)
AND only the sections that have batches running should be expanded. Sections with no batches running should be collapsed
AND the batch that is running should be identified with Running and the user who started the batch to the right of the batch name
AND if no batches are running "No batches are currently running" should display in the header and all sections should be collapsed
AND The page should not update in real time, updates should be made when the page refreshes

title: Update Batch Results and Batch History widget as a batch is running
custom_preconds: GIVEN a batch is currently running
custom_steps: WHEN user views the 2 batch widgets
custom_expected: THEN the 2 batch widgets should be updating on a regular basis

title: User wants to view LRD 40 man Payroll Impact and CBT Impact for each year of MJC
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is logged in and has permission to view Major Contracts
custom_steps: WHEN user opens an Approved Major Contract
custom_expected:
THEN every Approved contract should have a Payroll tab that has a "LRD 40-Man Payroll Impact" section for each year of the contract
AND every Approved contract should have a Payroll tab that has a "CBT Impact" section for each year of the contract

title: LRD user wants to add a new "As Of" date on the Payroll Tab
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user is logged in as an LRD user
AND user is viewing Payroll Tab
AND Payroll Tab is in edit mode
AND there is the option to add a new "As Of Date" to the Payroll Tab
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks the "New As Of Date" link above the As of Date field
custom_expected:
THEN system should open a pop-up that allows the user to pick a new calendar date to add as the new As Of Date. 
AND user should be forced to enter a valid date
AND save and Cancel buttons should be available on the pop-up
AND clicking "Cancel" should cancel the addition of the new date
AND clicking "Apply" should confirm the entry of the new date and refresh the screen to display the new date in the "As Of Date" dropdown
AND the new As Of Date should not be officially added to the system until the Payroll tab is saved
AND when a new as of date is added, comments, override CBT rate, manual supersede offset, and remove from reports values should always carry forward from the prior as of date record
AND if the calculated values for a particular “bucket” have not changed since the last as of date, and the last as of date had that “bucket” manually updated by a user, the manually updated value should carry forward to the new as of date

title: User wants to see which values have changed on the payroll tab since the last As Of Date
custom_preconds: GIVEN an "As Of Date" has been previously created on the payroll tab
custom_steps: WHEN a new "As Of Date" is created by an action in the system (batch marking a bonus earned, someone manually updating a contract, etc.) any values in the Payroll or Season Days section that differ from the previous As Of date should appear in a different color text than the remainder of the screen
custom_expected:
THEN system should flag the values displayed on the Payroll tab that have been updated since the last As Of date
AND any values in the Payroll or Season Days section that differ from the previous As Of date should appear in a different color text than the remainder of the screen
AND any columns that contain the different color texts should display an orange flag at the top of the column to indicate that there is a new value contained in the column
AND if a change is found in a column with an expansion, the main level column should have a flag, as well as whichever (or all) of the columns contained within the expansion that have changed values
BUT if a column has no changes, no flag should be shown on the individual column
AND these flags should always be dismissed when a new As Of date is added to the system for this Payroll tab. (Only the latest As Of Date will ever show these flags)

title: LRD user wants to delete an "As Of" date on the Payroll Tab
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is logged in as an LRD user
custom_steps: WHEN the user opens the Payroll Tab in edit mode
custom_expected:
THEN there should be the option to delete the "As Of Date" being viewed
AND "Delete" link should appear above the As of Date field if this is not the only As Of date present for the Payroll tab
AND clicking this link should ask the user to confirm the deletion of the As Of Date currently being viewed 
AND yes and No buttons should be available on the blocker
AND clicking "No" should cancel the deletion of the date
AND clicking "Yes" should remove the currently selected As Of Date
AND after a successful deletion the payroll tab should reload to display the most recent As Of Date
AND user must click "Save" on the Payroll to finalize the deletion of the As Of Date
BUT if only one as of date is present, "Delete" link should not appear

title: User wants saving changes to MJC to create a new As Of Date for the Payroll Tab
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a MJC exists in a preliminary or higher state (including the initial state change to Approved)
AND newly added payroll values on the MJC are different than their previous values
custom_steps: WHEN the MJC is saved
custom_expected:
THEN the CBT calculation should be run for that MJC
AND at the completion of the calculation, a new As Of Date should be created for the contract and should be reflected on the Payroll tab with the new calculations
AND users should receive a blue notification that states "Generated new CBT As of Date" along with any relevant successful save updates the contract would normally receive

title: LRD user wants to edit an "As Of" date on the Payroll Tab
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is logged in as an LRD user
AND user is viewing the Payroll tab in edit mode
AND there is the option to edit an existing "As Of Date" from the Payroll tab (not displayed in view mode)
AND "Edit" link appears above the "As Of Date" field
custom_steps: WHEN the user clicks teh "Edit" link
custom_expected:
THEN a popup should open that allows the user to pick a new calendar date for the selected As Of Date
AND user should be forced to enter a valid date
AND apply and Cancel buttons should be available on the pop-up
AND clicking "Cancel" should cancel the edit
AND clicking "Apply" should apply the new value to the selected as of date
AND user must save the Payroll screen for the edit to be maintained
AND cancelling changes to the payroll tab should set the As Of Date back to its original value
AND after a successful Save the contract should reload to display the newly updated As Of Date

title: User wants to flag an "As Of" date to be removed from reports
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is logged in and wants to flag an As Of Date to be removed from reports
custom_steps: WHEN user navigates to the Payroll tab
custom_expected:
THEN Payroll tab should have an "Additional Settings" collapsible section that matches the wireframe
AND "Remove From Reports" should be a checkbox available in the Additional Settings section
AND checking off the Remove from Reports checkbox should flag the As Of Date to be removed from all CBT and Payroll report calculations
AND any reports should not reflect any of the information contained on the current As Of Date. (won't be testable for the purposes of this test case so should just check that this is editable and remains checked on an "As of Date" basis.)
AND the checkbox setting should carry forward to the next As Of Date until it is manually removed.

title: User wants to override CBT Rate used in calculating displayed "As Of" date
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is logged in and attempting to add a new "As Of Date" on the Payroll Tab
custom_steps: WHEN user opens the payroll tab in edit mode
custom_expected:
THEN "Override CBT Rate" should a field available in the Additional Settings section
AND this field should only be editable in edit mode
AND default value should be 0%
AND user should be able to enter in a valid number with up to 3 decimal points
AND clicking re-calculate should reload the As Of Date Payroll with the newly calculated values using the entered rate
AND saving the Payroll tab should save the As Of Date using the calculated values
AND the entered rate should be maintained in the Override CBT Rate field for the relevant As Of Date
AND if a new As Of Date is created by the system for this Payroll tab, or is created manually, the system should carry forward the entered Override CBT Rate to future As Of Dates until it is cleared

title: UI of payroll tab should match updated wire
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is logged in with permissions to view the Payroll Tab
custom_steps: WHEN the user navigates to the payroll tab
custom_expected: THEN payroll tab layout should match the updated wireframe (http://copbdc.axshare.com/#p=payroll)

title: User wants to edit and save changes to Payroll Tab
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is logged in as an LRD user
AND user has navigated to the Payroll Tab
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks "Edit" button
custom_expected:
THEN system should reload both Season Days and the Payroll Section into edit mode
AND a "Save" button should be available on the form whenever the form is in edit mode
AND a "Cancel" button should be available on the form whenever the form is in edit mode
AND clicking Cancel should ask the user to confirm the cancellation of any changes
AND  if user confirms, any edits made should be cancelled and the form should be refreshed into view mode
BUT if user does not confirm, the pop up should be closed and the user should be returned to the form in edit mode
AND clicking Save should run a required field and format check on the form
AND Errors should be displayed in the system's standard required field and formatting error messages
AND global error handling, including sticky errors, should be used
AND once any errors have been resolved, a blue successful notification should display stating that changes have been saved

title: User wants to be able to view originally calculated values for a section that has been manually modified
custom_preconds:
GIVEN Payroll or Season Days have been manually modified on the payroll tab
AND user has the Payroll Tab open in view or edit mode
AND there is a "View" filter added to the appropriate section (visible in view and edit mode but can only be changed in View mode)
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks "Edit"
custom_expected:
THEN the system should refresh the screen to display the manually modified values for that "As Of" date
BUT user should not be able to re-edit originally calculated values without first resetting
AND the "View" filter should not be displayed for a section that has not been manually modified
AND if the view filter is displayed then the user should have the option to display the modified values or the originally calculated values for that "As Of" date
AND selecting a different view option should refresh the page to display appropriate values

title: User wants to see "Terms Changed" in extension checkbox on Payroll if certain conditions met
custom_steps: If a contract is in  a confirmed terms or later status and it supersedes (or will supersede, upon approval) another contract, a checkbox should appear to denote if terms have changed in the extension.

title: User wants to be able to Re-Calculate values based on their entries
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is logged in and viewing the Payroll Tab in edit mode
AND "Re-Calculate" button is available on the tab 
AND edits have been made to Season Days section, CBT Override rate, or Manual Supersede Offset Rate
custom_steps: WHEN the user clicks the "Re-Calculate" button
custom_expected:
THEN the system should take into account any edits on the page and re-calculate the Payroll information for the As Of date currently being viewed
AND re-calculated values should not be maintained until the user Saves the Payroll tab

title: User wants to enter a manual supersede Offset for a Payroll's "As Of" date
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is logged in and viewing payroll tab in edit mode
AND "Manual Supersede Offset" field is available in the Additional Settings section
custom_steps: WHEN user navigates to the "Manual Supersede Offset" field in the Additional Settings section
custom_expected:
THEN default value for this field should be blank - not 0
AND user should be able to enter in a valid number
AND clicking re-calculate should reload the As Of Date Payroll with the newly calculated values using the entered rate
AND saving the Payroll tab should save the entered Manual Supersede Offset for the entered as of date and the screen should display the As Of Date using the new calculation when it refreshes into View mode
AND if a new As Of Date is created by the system for this Payroll tab, or is created manually, the system should carry forward the entered Manual Supersede Offset to future As Of Dates until it is cleared

title: User wants multiple credits/refunds from the same source to roll up into single column
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is logged in and viewing the payroll screen
AND multiple credits or refunds exist for the same year, org, and type
custom_steps: WHEN user navigates to the payroll screen
custom_expected:
THEN all of the multiple credits and refunds that exist for the same year, org, and type should be rolled into a single column
AND if rolled up column gets manually modified the adjustments should be applied evenly across the rolled up records on save

title: User wants to reset modified values for an "As Of" date back to original calculations
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is logged in and viewing an "As Of" date on the payroll tab in edit mode
AND one or more values for the Payroll OR Season Days have been manually modified for the "As Of" date being viewed
AND "Reset Values" button is available on the bottom of the tab
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks the "Reset Values" button
custom_expected:
THEN system should  launch a popover that allows the user to select whether they want to reset the values for the Payroll section, the Season Days section, or both
AND only the sections that have been manually modified should be available to be selected. (If Payroll was not modified for this as of date, but Season Days were, then only Season Days is available to be selected)
AND when at least one of the sections is selected in the popup, the "Reset" button should be enabled
AND clicking "Reset" should refresh the page to display the originally calculated values for whichever section was reset
AND the modified values should be maintained until the user hits "Save" on the entire form
AND if the user cancels out of edit mode, then the modified values should be re-displayed in place of the calculated when the screen reloads into View mode
AND if the user Saves the changes, the modified values should no longer be available

title: User wants to reset modified values for an "As Of" date back to original calculations - Payroll or Season Days not modified
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is logged in and viewing an "As Of" date on the payroll tab in edit mode
AND neither the Payroll or Season Days have been manually modified for the "As Of" date being viewed
custom_steps: WHEN the user navigates to the Payroll Tab in edit mode
custom_expected: THEN "Reset Values" button should not be displayed

title: LRD user wants to receive approvals item when new As Of Date has been created for MJC Payroll Tab that requires LRD verification
custom_preconds: GIVEN conditions are met to leave the LRD Verified checkbox unchecked for a new as of date
custom_steps: WHEN the new As Of date has been created by the system (either by a batch earning a bonus earned or a manual save to a contract or any other means)
custom_expected:
THEN an approvals item should be generated for the LRD MJC Admin user to draw their attention to the relevant contract
AND Date should be the Date the new As Of date was set to
AND Org/Club From should be the Org of the contract
AND Player should be the player's Last, Roster
AND Trans Type should read "Contract Payroll Data requires LRD Verification"
AND Clicking the type column should take the user to the Payroll tab of the appropriate contract
AND Clicking the Player's Name should take the user to the player's player history on their profile

title: BOC admin wants to run MJC Stat Batch in Report mode
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a BOC admin user is logged in and wants to see which contracts would be updated by the MJ Stat batch
AND user has navigated to the MJ Contracts stat batch on the batches screen
AND "Report" appears as an option for "Mode" dropdown in batch parameters
AND user has selected "Report" from the "Mode' dropdown
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks "Run"
custom_expected:
THEN system should launch MJ Contracts Statistics batch
AND batch should not check for errors
AND all contracts that meet requirements should NOT be updated in the system
AND no statistic based bonuses should be earned
AND results from the batch should display in results widget when back is finished
AND if any item has an error, the error should NOT display in the error column to the left of the item in the results widget
AND batch History widget should update with latest batch history information

title: BOC admin wants to run MJC Stat Batch in Test mode
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a BOC admin user is logged in and viewing the MJ Contracts Stat batch on the Batches screen in the System Admin dashboard
AND "Test" appears as an option in the "Mode" dropdown in the batch parameters
AND user has selected "Test" in the "Mode" dropdown
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks "Run"
custom_expected:
THEN system should launch MJ Contracts Statistics batch 
AND test mode should run the batch and then roll back any changes made during processing - so that it can find any errors and what updates could actually be committed if you were to run the batch in update mode right now
AND contracts that meet requirements should NOT be updated in the system on the front end
AND no statistics based bonuses should be earned
AND results from the batch should display in results widget when batch is finished
AND if any item has an error, the error should display in the error column to the left of the item in the results widget
AND batch History widget should update with latest batch history information

title: User does not want to be able to select Major Contracts or Player Agent Mapping items on Clipboard
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is logged in
custom_steps: WHEN the user views the Approvals clipboard
custom_expected: THEN checkbox should not appear for Major Contracts or Player Agent Mapping items
